data.title: DirectTV SHEF IP Control Plugin for TVServer
data.meta_description:
Hello,

This is a plugin to control your DirectTV Reciever via IP control to change channels. Your DirectTV receiver needs to be connected to your network...
data.meta_site_name: MediaPortal - An Open Source Windows Media Center for FREE!
data.text:
marirs

Portal Member

April 29, 2011

17

3

Home Country

United States of America

May 2, 2011

#1

Hello,

This is a plugin to control your DirectTV Reciever via IP control to change channels. Your DirectTV receiver needs to be connected to your network in order for this to work. Place "DirecTV_SHEF.dll" in your "MediaPortal TV Server\Plugins" directory, and be sure to restart the TVService. Source is included.

Download

#6

If i am correct its only the H20/hdvr & up it works with. The older boxes dont have the SHEF commands. Easiest way to try is assign the box an ip then do ip/info/8080 & see if you get a screen that has more commands

#8

Hi -

Great plugin! I've been using the blaster plugin from IRSS to do this for the past year and wanted to create this same plugin to get rid of IRSS once and for all ;-) Less software always makes a better system!

I have looked at the implementation and made a few changes to attempt to have the DirecTV receiver turned off when time shifting stops. I also made added some message boxes to respond to the Test button on the plugin setup page.

The plugin is not receiving the message to stop shifting so I'm not sure if the message is being sent or what's going on. I don't have a lot of time atm to debug it; perhaps marirs, you could take a look? I've attached updated zip with source and binary (v 1.0.1.0).

Thanks again!

Attachments

DirecTV_SHEF.zip

#9

Hi,

I'm another possible SageTV convert.

I've been tinkering with MP for the last couple days and have a question regarding this plugin.

I currently have two DirecTV STBs. I am able to control both these boxes via my network with SageTV.

This plugin looks to be close to what I'm currently using - but, does this have the capability to control multiple STBs?

Not really wanting to go back to IR blasters...

Thanks,

Chris
